path: ./Audit_Reports_2024/Verichains_Lab/Verichains Public Audit Report - AshWard Smartcontracts - v1.1.pdf

findings.title: The for-loop in _getRewards function may cause an issue
findings.description: If the length of stake array is too large, the cost may be over the gas limit which causes the transaction to be reverted.

findings.title: GRANT_ROLE User Can Withdraw All Tokens
findings.description: The Vesting contract's collectToken function allows the GRANT_ROLE user to withdraw all tokens of the contract, and also through creating a new beneficiary by addBeneficiaries function.

findings.title: Sum of releasing token percentages not equal 100% INFORMATIVE
findings.description: The sum of releasing token percentages does not add up to 100%, which may cause unintended behavior.

findings.title: The getReward function call may cost larger than the gas limit
findings.description: The internal _getRewards function uses a for loop to calculate rewards, which may cause the cost to exceed the gas limit.

findings.title: User can reuse serverHash and serverSig in buyBox function
findings.description: The _commit function allows users to reuse the serverHash and serverSig values by passing a clientRandom value of 0 in the buyBox function.
